title: Prohibits excessive refueling charges by motor vehicle rental agencies
summary: Prohibits any motor vehicle rental agency in this state from charging more than ten percent above the average price of gasoline charged at gas stations located within a five mile radius of such agency's location, for the cost of refueling a rental vehicle upon its return.

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KRUGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when

       AN ACT to amend the general business law, in relation to excessive refu-
         eling charges by motor vehicle rental agencies

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The general business law is amended by adding a new section
    2  391-r to read as follows:
    3    S  391-R.  RENTAL  OF  MOTOR VEHICLES; EXCESSIVE REFUELING CHARGES. 1.
    4  DEFINITIONS. AS USED IN THIS SECTION:
    5    A. "MOTOR VEHICLE RENTAL AGENCY," OR "AGENCY,"  SHALL  MEAN  A  PERSON
    6  ENGAGED IN THE BUSINESS OF RENTING MOTOR VEHICLES IN THIS STATE;
    7    B.  "PERSON"  SHALL  MEAN  ANY  INDIVIDUAL, FIRM, CORPORATION OR OTHER
    8  LEGAL ENTITY;
    9    C. "MOTOR VEHICLE" SHALL HAVE THE MEANING ASCRIBED THERETO BY  SECTION
   10  ONE HUNDRED TWENTY-FIVE OF THE VEHICLE AND TRAFFIC LAW.
   11    2.  IT SHALL BE UNLAWFUL FOR ANY MOTOR VEHICLE RENTAL AGENCY TO CHARGE
   12  A PERSON WHO RENTS A MOTOR  VEHICLE  FROM  SUCH  AGENCY  MORE  THAN  TEN
   13  PERCENT ABOVE THE AVERAGE PRICE OF GASOLINE WITHIN A FIVE MILE RADIUS OF
   14  SUCH  AGENCY'S  LOCATION  AS THE COST OF REFUELING SUCH VEHICLE UPON ITS
   15  RETURN.
   16    3. ANY VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION SHALL CONSTITUTE  A  MISDEMEANOR  AND
   17  SHALL  BE PUNISHABLE BY A FINE OF NOT MORE THAN FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS, OR
   18  NOT MORE THAN ONE HUNDRED DAYS IN JAIL, OR BOTH.
   19    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
   20  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2653

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the general business law, in relation to excessive
refueling charges by motor vehicle rental agencies

PURPOSE OR GENERAL IDEA OF BILL:
The bill would
require that rental
car agencies in this state charge no more than ten percent above the
average price of gasoline at stations within a five mile radius of
such agency's location, as the cost for refueling a rental car upon
its return. Violation of this section would result in a misdemeanor,
punishable by a fine of up to $500, or not more than 100 days in
jail, or both.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
This bill would amend the General Business Law by adding a new
section 391-r which would prohibit rental car agencies from charging
excessive refueling costs.

JUSTIFICATION:
Most rental car agencies in this state are currently
charging an inflated cost for refueling of motor vehicles rented out
by such establishment, upon their return. The refueling charges in
the Metropolitan New York area are currently about $1.95/gallon. This
is practically a ninety percent mark-up over the current average
price/gallon of gas in that area. One may argue that this price
injustice could be easily remedied by simply refilling the tank on
one's own prior to returning the car. However, many business people
who rent cars are running on time schedules that may prohibit them
from doing this. In addition, and especially in light of recent
abuses of the rental car customer by the rental car industry, just
because a specific injustice is easily remedied doesn't mean that it
should be tolerated by the general public.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect on the first day of
November next succeeding the date on which it shall have become a law.
